oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Tex Ritter interview - Teddy Bart Noon Show - 1970-06-29 - WSM
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Tex Ritter (performer) conducted by Teddy Bart (host) on the Noon Show, broadcast on June 29, 1970 on radio station WSM (Nashville, Tenn.) Subject matter is Tex Ritter as a candidate for the 1970 Republican Primary.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Teddy Bart talks about future guests for his show Noon and introduces Tex Ritter -- Tex Ritter talks about moving into politics -- Ritter talks about studying law at the University of Texas and growing up around politics -- Ritter talks about always being interested in politics -- Ritter talks about how he cares a great deal about the environment -- Ritter talks about shutting down the mafia in New Jersey -- Ritter talks about being against drugs -- Ritter talks about how he is different from his competitor, Bill Brock -- Ritter talks about his beliefs in regards to the youth of America -- Ritter talks about his supporters, namely in Nashville -- Ritter talks about other republican candidates running -- Ritter talks about his campaign efforts -- Teddy Bart concludes the interview and urges his audience to vote on August 6, 1970 -- Bart introduces Orsa Lia -- Put A Little Love In Your Heart (Orsa Lia)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Ritter, Tex, 1905-1974; Bart, Teddy (Singer); WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Lia, Orsa
